intro: Mocinia mutisioides, commonly known as the Mexican wild coffee, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain a single seed. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
